content: @Kenny Lau I would like hear your thoughts. The PR seems like this wasn't too much of a change. Do you think it is fine/worth it? Or do you think we will hit roadblocks?
The main issue is the hierarchy of every ring hom is a group hom etc. I think what Cyril was talking about with unification hints might help here.
@Chris Hughes could you explain how rebasing and/or force-pushing is a bad idea?

Because then it's harder for me to see what has changed since I last looked at it. See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/compare/27883c109d31d3c8b7b6d49f09782b5ff3a89f94..52545586c6b32d58d353ed457367cf8ba768bfa4

The difference between two random commits is large?

Hey we have 1337 commits :-) Is that still a thing?

This is the PR that you force pushed, right? So everything is screwed up. I screwed up a PR recently (I rebased instead of merging when trying to update mathlib) and just decided to close and re-open.

You edited ring_theory/localization.lean in November, and then the other day you told it that you edited src/ring_theory/localization.lean in November, but that file wasn't even there in November. Or something.
